result.execSummary:
The defendant Kontrell Dashun Norman was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Kontrell D Norman in court with attorney Reyna Ivonne Morales.  Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by parties.  

efendant ordered to serve 6 months in the House of Correction with credit of 1 day time served.  Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for 12 months with the following conditions:

*Full time work and/or school.
*Perform 40 hours of community service. 
*Pay restitution in the amount of $130.27 to Walmart, during period of probation or civil judgment. 
*Defendant to pay all costs and surcharges during period of probation.  If unpaid a civil judgment will be ordered filed against the defendant.

filed:  Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

Defendant Kontrell D Norman in court with attorney Reyna Ivonne Morales.  Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Defendant prepared to enter change of plea.  Hearing proceeded.  Negotiations set forth by the state.

Defendant changes his plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.   Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 45.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for December 23, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Reyna Ivonne Morales in court.  Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case calendared for plea/sentencing 11/5/15, however, Atty Morales informed the court that her client cannot appear in court on the next scheduled date due to a work conflict. Court granted Defense's motion to adjourn, but issued and stayed a bench warrant until the next date. Case adjourned in branch 45.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 9, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Kontrell D Norman in court with attorney Reyna Ivonne Morales.  Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Case scheduled for plea and sentencing.  Court is in trial.  Case adjourned to Branch 45.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 5, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Kontrell D Norman in court with attorney Anne A. Devitt.  Morgan Willz supervised by Sarah McNutt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case set for Plea & Sentencing in branch 23 at request of defense counsel.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 6, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Kontrell D Norman in court.  Catelin Ringersma appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Case scheduled for status of counsel.  Defendant now wishes to go forward with Public Defender representation.  Court ordered case adjourned for status of counsel.  Parties are notified that effective August 3, 2015 this case will be reassigned per rotation to Judge Lindsey Grady, Branch 23 in Courthouse room 515.  Status conference scheduled for August 5, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Kontrell D Norman in court.  Elizabeth Longo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Defendant needs additional time to obtain private counsel.  Defendant notified that effective June 8, 2015 this case will be reassigned per rotation to Reserve Judge, Branch 45 in Courthouse room 515.  Status conference scheduled for July 16, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Oral No Contact Order with ANY Wal-Mart Stores.

Defendant Kontrell D Norman in court.  David John Behm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge Reserve, Branch 46.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant.  Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Defendant was given a referral to the Public Defender's Office. Defendant MAY be Public Defender eligible. The case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Br. 46.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 29, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE ARREST WARRANT.

Defendant Kontrell D Norman not in court.  Megan Patricia Carmody appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
OCCR Tape #15-069

Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered an Arrest Warrant to be issued.  Court ordered any bail posted to be forfeited.  State's motion for Judgment of Bond Forfeiture 30 days after notification from the Clerk of Circuit Court's Office is granted by the Court.  Court makes finding that there is a possible victim identified, therefore, Court stays order of forfeiture with recompense to be determined at close of case.
